description: Mindfulness-based techniques and interventions have become established as an empirically supported means of treating psychopathology and enhancing well-being. In this seminar, we will undertake a broad survey of the field, focusing on how mindfulness meditation changes the body, the brain and the mind. We will examine the evidence for the effects of mindfulness on cognition, emotion, stress, sleep, brain structure and function, physiology, and its uses in treating psychopathology. Mindfulness teachers, practitioners, clinicians, and app developers will be invited to share their experience and knowledge with the class.
title: The Psychology and Neuroscience of Mindfulness
